gurmukhi: ਜੋਗ ਬਿਖੈ ਭੋਗ ਅਰੁ ਭੋਗ ਬਿਖੈ ਜੋਗ ਜਤ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥ ਜੋਗ ਭੋਗ ਸੈ ਅਤੀਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jog Bikhai Bhog Aru Bhog Bikhai Jog Jata , Gurmukhi Pand Jog Bhog Sai Ateet Hai ?
translation: Where yogic practitioners have innate desire for worldly relishments and the worldly people desire to become yogi, but those treading the path of Guru maintain a very different and unique desire in their hearts than the yogis.

gurmukhi: ਗਿਅਾਨ ਬਿਖੈ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਅਰੁ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਬਿਖੈ ਬੇਧੇ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਕੈ ਅਜੀਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Giaan Bikhai Dhiaan Aru Dhiaan Bikhai Baydhay Giaana , Gurmati Gati Giaan Dhiaan Kai Ajeet Hai ?
translation: Those following the path of Gyan (knowledge) keep their mind focused on contemplation while those in contemplation are wandering for Gyan. But the state of a person treading the path of his Guru is above those persons who are pursuing Gyan or Dhyan (conte

gurmukhi: ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਕੈ ਭਗਤਿ ਅਰੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਕੈ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਨੇਮ ਅਲਖ ਭਗਤਿ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਰੀਤਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Praym Kai Bhagati Aru Bhagati Kai Praym Nayma , Alakh Bhagati Praym Gurmukhi Reeti Hai ?
translation: Followers of path of love yearn for devotion and those on path of devotion desire love, but the innate desire of Guru-conscious person is to remain engrossed in loving worship of God.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰਗੁਨ ਸਰਗੁਨ ਬਿਖੈ ਬਿਸਮ ਬਿਸ੍ਵਾਸ ਰਿਦੈ ਬਿਸਮ ਬਿਸ੍ਵਾਸ ਪਾਰਿ ਪੂਰਨ ਪ੍ਰਤੀਤਿ ਹੈ ||੪੨||
transliteration: Niragoun Saragoun Bikhai Bisam Bisvaas Ridai , Bisam Bisvaas Paari Pooran Prateeti Hai ?42?
translation: Many seekers hold a faith on the worship of Transcendental Lord while others hold a strange view of worship of God. Perhaps their belief and understanding is half baked. But the disciples of Guru hold their faith on the Lord much above these strange devot
